title: Weddington Country Walk Route

images.title: Michael Patterson / Climb to the Walk
images.caption: Climb to the Walk. This short climb up an old railway embankment is part of Weddington Country Walk.

images.title: Mat Fascione / In Loving Memory of Boudica
images.caption: In Loving Memory of Boudica This seat is located along the Weddington Country Walk next to the underpass which carries the Country Walk and National Cycle Network 52 under the A5 Watling Street. The seat is inscribed with: 'IN LOVING MEMORY OF BOUDICA, QUEEN OF THE ICENI, WHO DIED NEAR WATLING STREET AD62'

images.title: Mat Fascione / View towards Mount Judd
images.caption: View towards Mount Judd, a man made hill and landmark you can see from the trail. The hill is the former spoil tip of the Judkins Quarry, which extracted granite in the area. Mount Judd is a famous local landmark and in 2018 was voted the United Kingdom's "best landmark" in a Daily Mirror poll. At 158 metres (518 feet) altitude it is the 3,306th highest hill in England.

images.title: Cleaver Park Recreation Ground, in the snow, Nuneaton by N Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Cleaver Park Recreation Ground, in the snow, Nuneaton

images.title: The River Anker near Weddington by Mat Fascione, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The River Anker near Weddington. The Anker is a major tributary of the River Tame, which it joins in Tamworth. The name derives from the old British for winding river.

images.title: Michael Patterson / Climb to the Walk
images.caption: Climb to the Walk. This short climb up an old railway embankment is part of Weddington Country Walk.

description: This route takes you along the Weddington Country Walk near Nuneaton in Warwickshire. The shared cycling and walking trail runs along the trackbed of the old Ashby and Nuneaton Railway for a distance of about 1.5 miles. Start the walk to the south of Weddington at Sandon Park. The pleasant surfaced trail then heads north east towards Hungry Hill, just south of Higham on the Hill. The path makes up a section of Sustrans National Cycle Route 52 which can be used to further explore the area. If you were to head south you could pick up the Coventry Canal and enjoy some easy waterside walking or cycling.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Head into Weddington and you could enjoy some refreshments at the Anker Inn. The pub serves food and has a garden area to sit out in. You can find them at postcode CV10 0AN for your sat navs. They are dog friendly.
